results.title: Raku: the ancient art of Japanese ceramics
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and G Roy Levin
results.brief_description: The raku process began in the 12th century in Japan growing out of a Zen Buddhist religious ceremony. Raku firing offers the potter many advantages over other techniques, and provides an intimacy and immediacy more deeply felt than any other ceramic process. Narrated by Ann Dumaresq.

results.title: Rajneesh: Spiritual Terrorist
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Connop and Vision Quest Films
results.brief_description: From all over the world thousands of affluent and educated seekers flock to the Rajneesh’s ashram in Poona, India. We gain access to the Rajneesh and to the exotic private and public lifestyles that have earned him headlines around the world. The documentary also provides intimate portraits of some of the disciples around Rajneesh, including a young American actor, a former CIA agent, a German princess, a young Australian and Rajneesh’s personal dentist.

results.title: Raising the standard
results.creator_credit: John Spencer, James Carr, British Productivity Council and World Wide
results.brief_description: Discusses the British standard of living and relates it to productivity and ways in which both may be improved. Reorganising of work is essential, and problems involved are shown. The most important of these is the attitude and, not infrequently, the opposition of workers. There is a greater need for tactful handling of problems on the part of management. Labor must realise that more work, which leads to increased productivity, means higher standard of living and not simply higher profits and dividends. The film concludes with a discussion on these points.

results.title: Rapeseed Your Alternative Crop
results.brief_description: As wheat crops decrease in value Rapeseed farming is flourishing. This video examines not only the financial advantages of Rapeseed crops, but also those apparent to the wheat growing industry when crops of wheat are grown in paddocks where Rapeseed was produced the previous year. Not only does a higher yield occur, a 30% increase is evident, but there are less weeds, insects and wheat root diseases, the cycle of the latter having actually been broken by the planting of Rapeseed the previous year.

results.title: Rape: a crime of war (D)
results.creator_credit: Shelley Saywell, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Throughout history, the rape of innocent women during war time has been a common, but hidden occurrence; it is only now that an international court, The Hague, is trying to convict someone for rape as a war crime. This video follows four women who courageously recount their stories of rape and confinement in Bosnia during the recent conflict. It also conducts interviews with the legal personnel behind The Hague Trial. Archival footage from hearings in Nuremberg, Nanking, Rwanda and Bosnia are interspersed with images of Western art and culture which present a confusing portrayal of rape and attempt to legitimize rape during war time as an inevitable outcome. Previewing is recommended.

results.title: Rape. Part 2. Providing the proof
results.creator_credit: Richard Siegel, Karen Smith, Richard Cullather and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Deals with the preservation of corroborating evidence in the investigation of rape. Offers information on procedures, the establishment of fact, the collection and analysis of demonstrative evidence, the chain of possession, identification procedures and protection for the victim.

results.title: Rap race and equality
results.creator_credit: Grant Elliott, Stephen Elliott, Burberry Productions and Elliott Productions
results.brief_description: Rap and hip-hop were musical genres that developed within the African-American subcultures of America’s largest cities. Fusing funk, disco and a do-it-yourself punk aesthetic, rap music quickly became the defining voice of a generation of young, angry and disenfranchised black youth. In this incisive documentary, the history of rap and hip-hop is explored as well as the larger social context of American race and class relations. Interviews with Ice-T, Queen latifah, KRS-One, Chuck D and Rakim explore the context of rap’s evolution and offer necessary defences of the music’s relevance and importance to African-American youth; especially in the context of a popular media that has often dismissed rap as misogynist or “inauthentic”. Made by two Australian brothers who fell in love with the music, this documentary gives a voice to the power, impact, originality and importance of rap and hip-hop.

results.title: Rangi and papa: the Maori creation myth
results.brief_description: The Maori myth about the creation of the Earth. Life began with the Sky Father and the Earth Mother, who gave birth to the gods of the sea, winds and storms, food, forests, plunder, and earthquakes. Animated film with script and illustrations by Robert Jahnke, photography by Lindsay Whipp and narrated by George Henare.
